ai-thig3.5:1.1_0: “You cry ‘Please be living!’ in the forest.
ai-thig3.5:1.2_0: Ubbirī, get a hold of yourself!
ai-thig3.5:1.5_0: have been burnt in this funeral ground:
ai-thig3.5:1.6_0: which one do you grieve for?”
ai-thig3.5:2.1_0: “Oh! For you have plucked the dart from me,
ai-thig3.5:2.2_0: so hard to see, hidden in the heart.
ai-thig3.5:2.3_0: You’ve swept away the grief for my daughter
ai-thig3.5:2.4_0: in which I once was mired.
ai-thig3.5:3.1_0: But now I am sixteen darts,
ai-thig3.5:3.3_0: I go for refuge to that sage, the Buddha,
ai-thig3.5:3.4_0: to his teaching, and to the Sangha.”
